intro: Pavetta inyangensis, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture with a slightly waxy appearance. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have five petals, often in shades of white or pale yellow.
